item.title: Reacting is Easier
item.description: It’s easier to let other people find things to do with my time. React to their needs. It feels productive to make progress for others. To see that I can help them. Responding to emails, attending meetings, looking at Slack alerts. So I sit down to do some deep work: some heavy thought about big projects. And I find myself checking my email and looking for Slack alerts. Secretly hoping someone else will block out the next hour for me, so that I don’t have to drive forward my own thoughts.

item.title: Rain on Leaves
item.description: Rain began to beat down on me yesterday morning. I was trail running. I woke up before the sun. My mind was clear. I was doing my part. But the rain beat down on my path. It began to pour, and I could hear the orchestra of the raining forest: rain on leaves. And when I think about the sound of rain on leaves, I think of relaxation. I imagine most people do.

item.title: Tao of Running - Everything Balances
item.description: While reading the Tao Te Ching, I found that certain chapters connect very well with running. In order to further connect with these chapters myself, I “translated” them into a form that directly connects with running, which is a fundamental part of my life. This is from Chapter 2 of the Tao Te Ching; translated by Stephen Mitchell: Seeing some runs as beautiful makes other runs ugly Seeing some runs as good
